Articles.Content:
Simple question, i have one object (merged station, few pods, lab etc..) with more kerbals in complex. How can i recognize who is who? For Ex. I know that the Jeb and Val are pilots etc.. but what for the others? I want to select for example one scientist.. but who is who?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-29T14:31:21Z" title="06/29/2015 02:31  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 29, 2015</time> by Anthlon**
  
prefix change
You would have to launch them knowing what class they are, or you could be cheeky and go into the roster in the persistent.
If you go to map view in flight, then press the info button on the right side of the screen. It tells you the crew and their skill.

> 
> If you go to map view in flight, then press the info button on the right side of the screen. It tells you the crew and their skill.

Actually yes, this is much easier. Totally forgot about that.

I assume you want to see the profession of each Kerbal in a vessel after launch?

Just go to the map mode and click the Kerbal icon under the craft information, when the vessel is in focus. It will show a list of all crew members, including the profession for everyone.

Edit: Wow, double ninja...

Also, you can install the [DMagic's Portrait Stats modlet](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/120731-1-0-2-DMagic-s-Modlets-Latest-Update-EVA-Resource-Transfer-v1-0-6-20-2015) which shows an icon on the portrait.

What they need are starfleet colour coded suits! Engineers could have yellow markings, scientists blue markings and pilots red markings (I know it isn't the same for all Star Trek stuff but I'd choose these)
You can also still see them in the astronaut complex. They are listed in the "Assigned" tab of the roster. And the info button thing also works in the tracking station view.
Nice replies everyone, thanks a lot, first time doing this in more kerbals hanging around planets
